content: Confirmation e-mail has been sent to {{ownerName}}

comment.text: The translation key "ConfirmEmailSended" is used to display a success message after sending a confirmation email to an owner. It appears in a success notification dialogue, informing the user that a confirmation email has been sent to the selected owner. The message includes the owner's name for personalization.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Təsdiqləmə e-məktubu {{ownerName}} göndərilmişdir' is not the most natural way to express 'Confirmation e-mail has been sent to {{ownerName}}'. It literally translates to 'Confirmation e-mail {{ownerName}} has been sent.' A more natural phrasing would be something like '{{ownerName}} ünvanına təsdiqləmə e-məktubu göndərilmişdir'.

The Azerbaijani translation uses a direct translation of 'to' (ünvanına) which is more formal. Depending on the context and tone of the application, a simpler preposition could be more appropriate, although 'ünvanına' is grammatically correct.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a less formal preposition if appropriate for the tone. For example, '{{ownerName}} adlı hesabınıza təsdiqləmə e-məktubu göndərilmişdir'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: Missing space after "odeslán" before the variable {{ownerName}.
The word "Bestätiguns" is misspelled. It should be "Bestätigungs".

The phrase 'has been sent to {{ownerName}}' is translated as 'έχει σταλεί στον χρήστη {{ownerName}}'. While technically correct, it's overly literal.  'στον χρήστη' means 'to the user', which isn't necessary. A more natural Greek phrasing would imply the email was sent *for* the owner.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Το e-mail επιβεβαίωσης έχει σταλεί στον {{ownerName}}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Vahvistusviesti on lähetetty osoitteen {{ownerName}}' is not a natural or accurate translation of 'Confirmation e-mail has been sent to {{ownerName}}'. The phrase 'osoitteen' (at/to address) doesn't fit the context.
The translation uses a slightly different placement of the variable {{ownerName}} compared to the English source.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: While not strictly incorrect, maintaining the placement as 'Vahvistusviesti on lähetetty {{ownerName}}-osoitteeseen' is preferable for consistency.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Un messaggio e-mail di conferma è stato spedito a {{ownerName}}' is a bit verbose and not the most natural way to say 'Confirmation e-mail has been sent to {{ownerName}}'. A more direct translation would be better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Un'email di conferma è stata inviata a {{ownerName}}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Bevestiging e-mail is gestuurd naar {{ownerName}}' is not the most natural Dutch phrasing. A more natural translation would be 'Een bevestigingsmail is verzonden naar {{ownerName}}' or 'Er is een bevestigingsmail verstuurd naar {{ownerName}}'.
While technically correct, 'Bevestiging e-mail' sounds slightly awkward in Dutch. Using 'Een bevestigingsmail' (a confirmation email) flows better.

The translation 'Wiadomość e-mail z potwierdzeniem została wysłana do {{ownerName}}' is a bit literal and could be more natural.  A more common phrasing would be something like 'Powiadomienie e-mail zostało wysłane do {{ownerName}}' or 'E-mail z potwierdzeniem został wysłany do {{ownerName}}'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: E-mail z potwierdzeniem został wysłany do {{ownerName}}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Romanian translation 'Un mesaj pentru confirmarea adresei de email a fost trimis către {{ownerName}}' is a literal translation and doesn't convey the intended meaning of 'Confirmation e-mail has been sent to {{ownerName}}'. It's too verbose and doesn't sound natural.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more natural and accurate translation would be 'Email de confirmare a fost trimis către {{ownerName}}' or 'S-a trimis un email de confirmare către {{ownerName}}'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'තහවුරු කිරීමේ වි-තැපෑල {{ownerName}} වෙත යවා ඇත' is not the most natural or accurate translation of 'Confirmation e-mail has been sent to {{ownerName}}'. 'තහවුරු කිරීමේ වි-තැපෑල' (tahanuuru kirimē vi-tapaēla) translates to 'confirmation email,' but it sounds slightly awkward in Sinhala. A more natural phrasing would use a more common word for email.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: තහවුරු කිරීමේ ලිපිය {{ownerName}} වෙත යවා ඇත (tahanuuru kirimē lipiya {{ownerName}} vēta yava athā) - This translates to 'Confirmation letter has been sent to {{ownerName}}' and is more idiomatic in Sinhala.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, 'වි-තැපෑල' (vi-tapaēla) might be better rendered as just 'තැපෑල' (tapaēla) to avoid an unnecessary prefix. This is stylistic and depends on desired formality.

The translation 'Potvrdzujúci mail bol odoslaný' is not the most natural or accurate translation of 'Confirmation e-mail has been sent'. A more appropriate translation would be 'Potvrdenie bolo odoslané na tvoju e-mailovú adresu' or 'Potvrdenie bolo zaslané na tvoju e-mailovú adresu'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Potvrdenie bolo odoslané na tvoju e-mailovú adresu

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While not strictly incorrect, 'Potvrdzujúci mail' is slightly awkward. 'Potvrdenie' is a more suitable noun in this context.

The translation 'Емаил конфирмације је послат {{ownerName}}' is not a natural or accurate translation of 'Confirmation e-mail has been sent to {{ownerName}}'. The phrasing is awkward and doesn't convey the intended meaning clearly.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A better translation would be something like 'Емаил за потврду је послат {{ownerName}}' or 'Потврда је послата на имејл {{ownerName}}'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'Емаил' is a transliteration and not a standard Serbian word. It should ideally be replaced with a more localized term.

The translation 'Email konfirmacije je poslat {{ownerName}}' is not a natural or accurate translation of 'Confirmation e-mail has been sent to {{ownerName}}'. A more natural translation would be something like 'Email za potvrdu je poslat {{ownerName}}' or 'Poslana je email potvrda za {{ownerName}}'.

The phrase 'Email konfirmacije je poslat' uses the dative case ('konfirmacije') when the genitive might be more appropriate depending on the intended meaning. Using 'potvrde' is arguably better, indicating that the email is *for* confirmation.

The translation 'Onay e-postası şu kişiye gönderildi {{ownerName}}' is not a natural or accurate translation of 'Confirmation e-mail has been sent to {{ownerName}}'. A better translation would reflect the passive voice and be more concise.

The translation 'Електронний лист-підтвердження надіслано {{ownerName}}' is a bit literal and could be improved for natural flow in Ukrainian. A more common and natural phrasing would be something like 'Підтвердження надіслано на електронну пошту {{ownerName}}' or 'На {{ownerName}} надіслано електронний лист з підтвердженням'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: На {{ownerName}} надіслано електронний лист з підтвердженням.
